transportAdvice: Lake Tahoe has limited public bus service connecting some resort towns and communities around the lake, but a car is strongly recommended as walking between attractions is generally impractical given the spread-out nature of the region. Taxis and ride-hail services are available but can be scarce outside peak seasons, so arranging transport in advance is advisable.

weather.description: Cold winter month with frequent snowfall, ideal for skiing but expect icy roads and limited accessibility.
Peak ski season continues with heavy snow possible and cold temperatures throughout the region.
Late winter brings variable conditions with some sunny days mixed with significant snowstorms.
Spring begins with melting snow at lower elevations but cold nights and possible late-season storms remain.
Mild and pleasant with snow receding, trails beginning to open and the lake becoming more accessible.
Early summer brings warm days and cool nights, with outdoor activities ramping up and crowds beginning to arrive.
Peak summer month with warm sunny days, ideal for swimming, hiking, and water sports on the lake.
Hot and dry with the busiest tourist crowds, excellent conditions for all outdoor and water activities.
Crowds thin out and temperatures remain pleasant, making this one of the most enjoyable months to visit.
Autumn colors appear around the lake with cooler temperatures and the first possibility of early snowfall at elevation.
Winter approaches with cold temperatures, early snowfall, and ski resorts beginning to prepare for the season.
Cold and snowy with ski season underway, festive atmosphere in resort towns but travel can be challenging.
